short_summary: Generation of quantitative data for the performance of candidate steel pipes and fittings in gaseous hydrogen environments for the transportation and distribution of hydrogen gas by existing and future pipeline systems.
description: The contract will assess the tensile properties, fatigue performance, and fracture toughness of steel pipes and fittings in air and in high pressure gaseous hydrogen environment. It will also determine the properties degradation of the examined steels under specific hydrogen environment.
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement
### Assessment of Fatigue and Toughness of Steel Pipes and Fittings in Gaseous Hydrogen

### Ministerial Department of Natural Resources Canada
#### Reference: cb-317-34531064

#### Publication Date: February 5, 2024
#### Tender Closing Date: April 30, 2024 2:00 PM EST

#### Section 1: Contract Description
Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) invites offers to conduct an assessment of the fatigue and toughness of steel pipes and fittings in gaseous hydrogen environments. The contract aims to gather quantitative data for the performance of candidate steel pipes and fittings in gaseous hydrogen to evaluate their suitability for hydrogen gas transportation and distribution through existing and future pipeline systems.

The contract has two phases: Phase 1 (36 weeks starting in 2024-25) and an optional Phase 2 (72 weeks starting in 2025-26).

**Scope of Work**

* Assess tensile properties, fatigue performance, and fracture toughness of selected steel pipes and fittings in air.
* Evaluate fatigue crack growth rate and fracture toughness (JQ) of selected steel pipes and fittings in high-pressure gaseous hydrogen (up to 3000 psi of pure hydrogen gas).
* Determine quantitatively the properties degradation of examined steels in specific hydrogen environments.
* Develop knowledge and information for conducting in-situ mechanical testing in high-pressure hydrogen gas and blends.

**Tendering Requirements**

* Bids will be evaluated based on the lowest price.
* The contract is open to bidders under the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement.

**Contact Information**
**Stephen Vener**, Contracting Authority
**Email:** [steve.verner@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca](mailto:steve.verner@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca)
**Phone:** (343) 543-6090
**Address:** 580 Booth Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0
